description.narrative: The overall goal of the project is to generate additional opportunities for the promotion of full and productive employment for young people, thereby contributing to the achievement of the objectives of Albania’s National Action Plan for Youth Employment. Replication of the successful pilot model in two more regions of Albania (Lezha and Shkodra) and institutionalisation of it in Kukes; respectively bringing it up for replication at the national level are also aimed. Outcomes (objectives): The contribution to UNDP TEP project - aligned with Albanian Action Plan for Youth Employment - aim at: (1): Youth employment is a priority in the regional development strategies. (2): Incidence of informal and low-productivity jobs is reduced through innovative programmes targeting disadvantaged youth at risk of labour market exclusion. (3): The employability and income generating potential of youth enhanced through active labour market measures implemented under a public private partnership framework in three selected regions. (4): An enabling environment for youth employment as part of the larger corporate social responsibility agenda is promoted by relevant stakeholders.

organisation.narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation SDC

recipient-region.narrative: regions of Kukes, Shkodra and Lezha

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
